title: Herschel Beahm NCMEC Referral

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Herschel Beahm NCMEC Referral
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any and all records, including but not limited to reports, investigations, referrals, communications, case files, and evidence, relating to National Center for Missing and Exploited Children (NCMEC) CyberTipline reports about Guy "Dr Disrespect" Beahm received or investigated by the San Diego County Sheriff's Department from January 1, 2019 to the present.

2. Any and all records of communications, including emails, letters, and memos, between the San Diego Internet Crimes Against Children (ICAC) Task Force and the San Diego County Sheriff's Department regarding NCMEC CyberTipline reports or investigations relating to Guy "Dr Disrespect" Beahm from January 1, 2019 to the present.

3. Any and all records of communications, including emails, letters, and memos, between Twitch Interactive, Inc. and the San Diego County Sheriff's Department or the San Diego ICAC Task Force regarding Guy "Dr Disrespect" Beahm from January 1, 2019 to the present.

If any responsive records contain exempt information, I request that you redact the exempt material and release the remainder of the records, as required by Government Code Section 6253(a).

If any of the above requests are determined to require an unreasonable amount of time to produce, please provide me with the records that can be reasonably produced within the 10-day statutory deadline and the estimated date when the remainder of the records will be available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Locke

title: ChatGPT

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: ChatGPT
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that ChatGPT is a major topic of conversation at American public schools: https://nbc-2.com/news/local/2023/02/15/students-at-cape-coral-high-school-accused-of-using-artificial-intelligence-to-cheat-on-essay/amp/

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials related to ChatGPT. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed ChatGPT and B) Any other documents related to ChatGPT including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) Any memos or communications sent to schools, administrators, teachers, parents, or students that mention "ChatGPT."

3) Any case studies, enforcement actions, contracts, or other documents mentioning ChatGPT 

4) Any academic dishonesty policies that mention ChatGPT

5) To the extent possible, any emails and associated attachments that mention ChatGPT

To help limit the extent of the responsive documents, please limit search from November 20, 2022 through the time this request is processed. Please deliver these documents on a rolling basis as responsive documents are found.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Gabriel Garcia.

title: CLASSIC WIZARD (U.S. Navy)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Access to and copies of records related to the Navy program known as “CLASSIC WIZARD,” which was active during the 1970s. Specifically, I am seeking:

	1.	Program documentation: Any available documents detailing the objectives, scope, and operations of the “CLASSIC WIZARD” program.
	2.	Reports and evaluations: Copies of any reports, evaluations, or assessments generated by or for the “CLASSIC WIZARD” program.
	3.	Declassified materials: Any materials related to the “CLASSIC WIZARD” program that have been declassified, including but not limited to project summaries, technical reports, and correspondence.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabriel Garcia

title: NPS Complaints about Amistad National Recreation Area

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NPS Complaints about Amistad National Recreation Area
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any complaints of harassment received by the National Park Service regarding Amistad National Recreation Area  made between January 2015 to June 2024.
Any complaints of discrimination received by the National Park Service regarding Amistad National Recreation Area made between January 2015 to June 2024.
Any complaints of workplace safety received by the National Park Service regarding Amistad National Recreation Area made between January 2015 to June 2024.
Any complaints of retaliation received by the National Park Service regarding Amistad National Recreation Area made between January 2015 to June 2024.
Any tort claims received by the National Park Service regarding Amistad National Recreation Area made between January 2015 to June 2024.

National Park Service includes but is not limited to; any office, employee, internal database, email system, paper or digital records, mobile devices, or computer systems utilized within the service to submit, review, discuss, track, or investigate complaints; including but not limited to the offices of Employee Relations, Regional Office, Chief Rangers Office, Regional Superintendents Office, EEO, Safety Manager, 16-E, ISB, IMARS.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Veritas Oversight

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any complaints received by the National Park Service regarding their employee Chris Ryan. Including any dispositions and final determinations.
Any investigations conducted by the National Park Service regarding their employee Chris Ryan. Including any dispositions and final determinations.
Any disciplinary personnel actions by the National Park Service regarding their employee Chris Ryan. Including any dispositions and final determinations.
Any records received by National Park Service, Regional Superintendent, supervisor, manager, regarding any complaints, adverse conduct, poor performance, and disciplinary actions for employee Chris Ryan.
Any records received by the National Park Service regarding their employee Chris Ryan and violations of ethics, destruction of government property, 36 Code of Federal Regulations, Archaeological Resources Protection Act.
Any complaints received by the National Park Service regarding their employee Chris Ryan and workplace safety, Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ), United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).
A complete copy of the SF-50 for National Park Service employee Chris Ryan.

National Park Service includes but is not limited to; any office, employee, internal database, email system, paper or digital records, mobile devices, or computer systems utilized within the service to submit, review, discuss, track, or investigate complaints; including but not limited to the offices of Employee Relations, Regional Office, Chief Rangers Office, Regional Superintendents Office, EEO, Safety Manager, 16-E, ISB, IMARS.
Complaints include but is not limited to any digital or paper record received by the National Park Service or any of its employees, relating but not limited to; harassment, threats, retaliation, assault, intimidation, discrimination, safety, memos, adverse performance, and any other violation of administrative policy, safety policy, and criminal law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Veritas Oversight

title: KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – Superintendent Search Records and Former Superintendent Consulting Records

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – Superintendent Search Records and Former Superintendent Consulting Records
communications.communication:
06-28-2024

via email to PublicRecords@kent.k12.wa.us

KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – Superintendent Search Records and Former Superintendent Consulting Records 01-01-2020 to 06-28-2024

https://www.kent.k12.wa.us/domain/4197

"At a special board meeting on April 20, 2022, the Kent School District (KSD) Board of Directors named Mr. Israel Vela as the next superintendent, after previously serving as the Interim Superintendent throughout the 2021-2022 school year. Mr. Vela was chosen after an extensive search process, based on his distinguished career as a teacher, principal, and district leader in Washington State and years of service in KSD."

https://ilovekent.net/israel-vela-selected-as-superintendent-for-kent-school-district/

"Vela is replacing Dr. Calvin Watts, who left to take a Superintendent job in Georgia. He was chosen after an extensive superintendent search process conducted by McPherson and Jacobson, LLC that culminated in three finalists visiting the district and participating in virtual interviews, staff meetings, and town halls."
 
 KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – Superintendent Search Records and Former Superintendent Consulting Records
 
 Via email: PublicRecords@Kent.k12.wa.us

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. Any/all records and writings regarding the "superintendent search process" conducted by the KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT any time during the years 2020-Present.

2. Any/all records and writings referencing McPherson and Jacobson, LLC.

3. Any/all records and writings referencing individuals considered candidates for Kent School District Superintendent in the years 2020-2024.

4. Any/all records and writings referencing any employment, consulting, or payments to any FORMER Kent School District Superintendent. 

DATE RANGE OF REQUEST

The date range for records responsive to this request is January 1, 2020 - June 28, 2024.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation or NEXT-REQUEST.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, or NEXT-REQUEST.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide copies of all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of
Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

title: TDY Lodging_6

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: TDY Lodging_6
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

correspondence between Kennith Wingard and any email address within the domain @warfighterhousing.com. This request includes all sent and received emails, attachments, and any other electronic communication from January 1, 2022, to the present.
This request encompasses all forms of communication, including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and any other written correspondence.
To facilitate your search for these records, please ensure that the search includes any emails where Kennith Wingard is either the sender or recipient, and the other party's email address ends with @warfighterhousing.com.

I am an independent researcher investigating how housing allowances issued to service members on temporary duty status (TDY) are being used. This includes any formal or informal relationships between unit commanders/leadership and commercial housing providers, to include how leadership may be directing SMs to specific commercial providers and what incentives are being offered to do so. The purpose of my project is for developing a better understanding of how the government works after authorizing housing allowances to SMs on temporary duty status (TDY), what controls are in place at the unit level, and what protocols are in place to ensure taxpayer funded housing allowances are used as authorized.

The outcome of my research will be to produce a series of web-based essays using primary sources obtained by my FOIA requests. This final work product will be released with the aim of educating the public on the importance of temporary duty status (TDY) travel and the safeguards in place to protect against the potential for abuse.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David C

title: FBI: Paul Albert Thiry

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Paul Albert Thiry
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau records related to the architect Paul Albert Thiry (born September 11th, 1904 - died 1993). Of particular interest would be personal correspondence between Paul Thiry and directors L. Patrick Gray, Bill Ruckelshaus and Clarence Kelley regarding the planning, design, dedication of, and reaction to, the opening of the J. Edgar Hoover Building on September 30th of 1975. Mr. Thiry acted as a consultant during this process. Thiry was also actively engaged in civic issues in the city of Seattle. Thiry was also appointed by President Kennedy to the U.S. Capitol Planning Commission and the President's Council on Pennsylvania Avenue - both appointments who have presumably generated a background check and documentation from the bureau. 

This request is for any and all records about the architect Paul Albert Thiry from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Thiry held by the Seattle Field Office. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Paul Albert Thiry. 

For a brief synopsis of his career please see:

https://www.docomomo-wewa.org/architect/thiry-paul/

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Paul Thiry.

Please include a search of any records or documents understood to be, or colloquially referred to as "COINTELPRO records" under the bureau's custody that could be construed as responsive to a request for records related to Paul Thiry. 

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or if certain portions must be redacted, please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Please Note: A previous FOIA request to the bureau, "FBI file 66-HQ-11201 " titled: "Planning And Design of the FBI Headquarters Building 66-HQ-11201" mentions Thiry by name. Please disregard this document in your search.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Information Regarding Alejandro Luis Antunez de Mayolo Mendez (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Information Regarding Alejandro Luis Antunez de Mayolo Mendez (Central Intelligence Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all files related to Alejandro Luis Antunez de Mayolo Mendez and his son Alejandro Antunez de Mayolo. Alejandro Luis once served as the Chief of Staff to General Artemio Palomino Toledo as noted in a declassified Military Intelligence Summary (Volume VIII, Latin America) published by the DIA in 1986. In April 1992, Alejandro Luis's son, Alejandro Antunez de Mayolo, was assassinated by the shining path in an attempt to assassinate Alejandro: https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1992-04-10-mn-194-story.html. Given that Alejandro Luis Antunez de Mayolo passed away on January 9, 2024 (attached is a photo of the announcement that was printed in El Comercio), releasing this information should not have any personal impact on Alejandro Luis or Alejandro.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alonso ADM

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the computer aided dispatch report for the CLOSED CASE of the Watercolor house party, owned at the time were Ashley and Ryan Templeton.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Chase Galloway

title: Herman Paul Pressler III (June 4, 1930 – June 7, 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Herman Paul Pressler III (June 4, 1930 – June 7, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former judge and Southern Baptist Convention leader Herman Paul Pressler III (June 4, 1930 – June 7, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/16/obituaries/paul-pressler-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, Reason Magazine, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Email sent to Judge PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) from Kevin Riford regarding Christina Little

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Email sent to Judge PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) from Kevin Riford regarding Christina Little
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.) Any and all emails received by PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) from sender Kevin Riford (kevinriford@outlook.com) on 6/25/2024.

2.) Any and all emails sent from PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) to Kevin Riford (kevinriford@outlook.com) 6/25/2024.

3.) Any and all emails received by PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) from sender Kevin Riford (kevinriford@outlook.com) on 6/27/2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Riford Family

title: Government Employee Salary Data (Department of Human Services)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Government Employee Salary Data (Department of Human Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the most recent database maintained by this agency detailing government employee compensation across the state.

I am specifically requesting that this release include, for each State employee, the following: Name of Employee, Age, Gender, Ethnicity, Job Title, Agency/department, City/location in which employee is stationed, and Earnings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam
